txt.en: 'You did very well, friends. Unh....'
'I will travel to the right.'
'Get them logs up with what? You talk too big, Rigûl.'
'You lazy sod, you'd best be ready to fight.'

'The path diverges ahead. I shall follow the trail to the right, you follow the path to the left. If all goes well, we will meet again upon the peak of Weathertop. Wait until I have passed from sight before you proceed.\n\n'Remember, we must defeat the leaders of this war-band if we are to discourage them. Use the torches you find on the unlit pyres along the path. They may draw the attention of nearby Orcs.'
'My wounds are grievous, but I shall recover. Come, we shall return to my camp.'
'It's time for you to go.'
'Wait! Let the patrol move out of sight.'

'We must make haste, [placeholder]. We have the leaders of these Uruk-hai cornered like rats upon the slopes of Weathertop. If we can defeat them, we may yet break the will of this war-band and drive them whimpering to their masters in the South. Be prepared for anything.'

'You have done well, [placeholder], better than I, it appears. Uruk-hai and Orcs nearly bested me and my wounds run deep.\n\n'But you must not concern yourself with me now. Beyond that gate is the Uruk who leads this force. Pass through the gate and defeat him. We cannot allow these Orcs to have a hold in the north.'
'If we are careful we may drive the Orcs away.'
'A foul Orc-leader lay ahead!'
'You take the path to the left....'
'Goblins! They must have been pressed into service.'
'Look ahead, a craban, vile scout for the Orcs.'
'Fools! I'll see my Warg feast upon your flesh!'
'I fear my injuries are greater than I expected, friends.'
'Let us quicken our pace.'
'You did very well, friend. Unh....'
'Perhaps we can light a fire to draw the goblins' attention.'
'Their leaders have all gathered on the hill.'
'I will remain here to stop the enemy, should they decide to flee.'
'Use the torch on the wood. We may draw attention and split their force.'
'Be prepared for anything.'
'For the White Hand!'
'We will meet at the crest of Weathertop.'
'You Orcs needing us to save your necks? A [placeholder]! Get 'em!'
'We will need to slow our pace. The rocks ahead can easily hide an ambush.'
Speak with Candaith
'We need to be swift. These Orcs must be driven out of the Lone-lands.'
'Fly, fly from here! We are defeated!'
Protect Candaith
Speak with Candaith
Speak with Candaith at Weathertop's peak
Escort Candaith to the gate
Defeat Rigûl
Defeat Rigûl's minions
Speak with Candaith
'Your theft has not gone unnoticed.'
Speak with Candaith
'The White Hand endangers his servants by his actions.'
'He is more a fool than I thought, Angmar controls the north.'
'Dúnedain! You shall join your brethren soon.''
'Over here, quickly!'
'Now you see, Uruk-hai. Leave the north to Angmar.'
'Do as you are told, cur, or Mordor will march upon your master!'
'It appears that my injuries are worse than I feared, friend.'
Candaith has been defeated. You have failed
'They lit the fires! We're under attack!'
Candaith wishes to speak with you
Seek out the enemies Bûb-hosh and Muz
'Those flea-bitten goblins had best learn their place.'
You have defeated Bûb-hosh
'Stay up on that hill, you little wretches!'
You have defeated Muz, the Warg-keeper
'Ungrateful worms! Sharkû will hear about this!'
Find and defeat the Uruk-hai leader
'Attack!'
You have defeated Rigûl
'Stay by me until the time is right....'
You have defeated Olog-snaga
'Let us learn the intent of this meeting....'
You have defeated Olog-snaga
'He should have kept his mouth shut. Serves him right.'
'The road diverges ahead. We will need to split up.'
'Shut your gobs. We needs no more surprises.'
'We cannot fail here.'
'Keep faith, boys, we've a surprise for him.'
'We must end this threat! Wait, did you hear something?'
'More goblins ahead. Let us be cautious.'
'I can't believe he killed him.'
'You don't mouth off to the likes of 'em.'
'You boys follow me.'
'I smells something in the air, Rigûl... I smells Târk.'
'I will open the gate and hold the rear guard.'
'What's the hurry, Rigûl? The hill's ours....'
'I'll get the goblins and Orcs. We'll get this târk!'
'This torch may prove useful.'
Instance: Retake Weathertop
'I fear that there is something more here than an Uruk-hai.'
'Keep a close watch. We don't want no surprises.'
'Craban, you keep watch. No more surprises.'
'You fool! We are doomed!'
'Fell spawn of the South, begone from this place!'
'Careful, there are Orcs ahead.'
'We must make haste.'
'Anything comes this way, and it'll be sorry.'
'Take up the torch....'

The Ranger Candaith has enlisted your aid in a quest to remove the threat of Orcs from the Weather Hills. Candaith believes that the presence of Orcs from the South upon Weathertop is a precursor to an invasion of Eriador.
'Oh, you'll have such fun with Throk-goth!'
'For the White and Sharkû, kill them all!'
'Pick up the pace, you sluggards!'
'That's the half of it, toad! We'll not keep Sharkû waiting!'
'More Orcs! Prepare yourselves!'
'Use your head, you worthless slug!'
'Remember the torches. Light the bonfires. This may help you.'
'Man-flesh? Let's take a look, boys.'
'I'll not be beaten by you! I've a little surprise!'
'Now you die!'
'Get down the hill and bring up the logs. We've a pyre to build.'
'Get Olog-snaga down there and put him to work!'
'One of you take that torch....'
'We need to discover the origin of this menace. Follow me!'
'Do not engage the foe until we have learned more.'
'Stay close. A fall from Weathertop could be fatal.'
'If you come across Bûb-hosh or Muz, defeat them.'
'Get away from that Warg!'
You have arrived at the foot of Weathertop to discover that Orcs from the South have made their way to the crest. Candaith awaits your assistance in driving the war-band from the ruins of Amon Sûl.

A small force of goblins greeted you at the foot of Weathertop. Candaith has sent you upon the path to the left, while he will clear the path to the right, meeting once again upon the crest of Weathertop.
Candaith sent you up one branch of the path up Weathertop, while he took the other, in search of the leaders of the Orc war-band.
Somewhere above you on the path, Candaith waits to speak with you again.\n\nYou have defeated two of the leaders of the Orc war-band.
'I smell a Târk! We'll eat well tonight, boys!'
You have found the leader of Saruman's expedition, the Uruk Rigûl. You must defeat Rigûl and his minions to break their will and drive them from the Weather Hills.
The Uruk-hai expedition lies in ruins. You have won the day. You should speak with Candaith.
'You are not welcome here!'
'Calling me a spineless nit... I ought to kill 'em all!'
